Description: Fragment from near centre of Attic red-figured pottery lid, with the root of the knob. Inside glazed. Outside, female perhaps moving to right, her body frontal, head turned to left; preserved are her face, neck, and some drapery; added white in hair and as dots on glazed area of 'drapery'.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'Probably a pyxis or lekais lid of a class similar to no. 378 [Alexandria 9367].'
Boardman in his review of Venit wonders whether there are wings, not drapery.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 107 no. 380 pl. 80)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2121)
